1<s>st</s> Year (2013) Issue(s): Vegetation in the area cleared for the HDD from KP 0.0 to KP 0.1 has not yet established. Vegetation cover is expected to improve in subsequent years.
2<s>nd</s> Year (2014) PCRM Assessment a: July 4, 2014 - ~ 85-90% vegetation establishment as opposed to off RoW control. Good Native grass establishment Common weeds, comparable to off RoW. No erosion, subsidence or contour issues.
2015 PCRM Assessment and Work Completed: June 11, 2015 - Undisturbed portion of RoW is well vegetated, presence of minor, non-noxious weeds noted. Approximately 95% vegetation establishment as opposed to off RoW control.   - Recent construction of adjacent pipeline has encroached on RoW, straw wattle material has been placed and is effectively controlling potential erosion, continue to monitor in 2016.

1<s>st</s> Year (2013) Issue(s): HDD construction method was used in this area as a part of the Cutbank River watercourse crossing and no disturbance took place. No concerns were observed.
2<s>nd</s> Year (2014) PCRM Assessment a: July 4, 2014 - ~ 95+% vegetation establishment within forested section as opposed to off RoW. Horizontally Drilled, no ground disturbance. The only impact is trees have been slashed 1m width for `600m to the Cutbank River. No Issues.
2015 PCRM Assessment and Work Completed: June 11, 2015 - Approximately 95% vegetation coverage as opposed to off RoW. This area was horizontally drilled – No erosion no ground disturbance on surface.   - 1m slashed area is beginning to fill in with emerging tree and plant species, on both sides of Cutbank River.

1<s>st</s> Year (2013) Issue(s): The Cutbank River located at KP 0.7 was crossed using HDD construction methods and no disturbance to the banks of the river took place. No concerns were observed up to KP 1.0.

2015 PCRM Assessment and Work Completed: June 11, 2015 - Approximately 95% vegetation coverage as opposed to off RoW. This area was horizontally drilled – No erosion no ground disturbance on surface.   - 1m slashed area is beginning to fill in with emerging tree and plant species, on both sides of Cutbank River

2015 PCRM Assessment and Work Completed: June 11, 2015 - ~95% vegetation establishment as opposed to off RoW, several bare patches on north side of HDD, monitor in 2016. - Noxious weed (perennial sow thistle) observed at KP 0+700 to 1+580, mainly on ditchline. 1<s>st</s> Year (2013) Issue(s): No issues observed on the right-of-way.

1<s>st</s> Year (2013) Issue(s): Moderate vegetation establishment observed over the right-of-way starting at KP 2.0. Vegetation cover is expected to improve in subsequent years.

1<s>st</s> Year Issue/ Condition: Watercourse Crossing: Unnamed Tributary to Cutbank River
1<s>st</s> Year (2013) Issue(s): No concerns were observed at the watercourse crossing at KP 3.0. Vegetation establishment is high on the channel banks of the tributary, although low on the slopes leading to the tributary. Erosion control measures are in place and functional.
2<s>nd</s> Year (2014) PCRM Assessment a: July 24, 2014 - Unnamed tributary to Cutbank River (KP 2+960) stable at time of assessment. South side of bank exhibits lesser vegetation establishment compared to north bank. Rollback effective. Willows establishing well on both banks.  Small patch of scentless chamomile found on south bank of tributary - weeds were hand-picked. Revetment posts and Dekawe material functioning well at time of assessment. Recommend leaving silt fence in place at this time. Continue to monitor in 2015.
2015 PCRM Assessment and Work Completed: June 11, 2015 - Vegetation is comparable to off ROW.  Vegetative cover approaches 100% on the north side of the crossing and 50% on the south side of the crossing. Woody infill (willow) was observed. Common, non-noxious weeds observed in limited densities.   - Minimal water flow was observed. - Banks appear to be stabile with no subsidence or erosion observed. - Diversion berms and silt fencing are functioning and well vegetated. Rollback, employed as an erosion control measure, is effective. - Recommend removing all (approximately 200’) of silt fencing from the north side of the crossing, while leaving the south silt fencing in place, as it is required and functional. - Tall buttercup and perennial sow thistle were observed, recommend spot spraying. July 27, 2015 - Removed all of the silt fencing, associated stakes and t-bars from the north side of the crossing. September 18, 2015 - Herbicide was applied to control noxious weeds.

2015 PCRM Assessment and Work Completed: June 15, 2015 - RoW is well vegetated, approximately 75 to 85% vegetation cover on RoW compared to off RoW control.  Patches of reduced vegetation cover were noted at KP 3+300 and 3+700 to 3+900, monitor. - Common, non-noxious weeds observed in limited densities. Tall buttercup and perennial sow thistle observed from KP 3+300 to 4+180, recommend spot spraying. - Diversion berms/ditches are functional and vegetating.  The associated silt fencing is function and required to remain in place. - Erosion rills observed at KP 3+600. The erosion rills are well vegetated and no work is required, monitor to ensure erosion does not worsen. - Ditch plugs, effectively functioning at KP 4+100 and 4+130.  Water emerging with minor erosion at both locations.  ATV tracks are present.  Recommend the installation of straw wattles to limit further erosion. July 11, 2015 - Spot spraying was conducted from KP3+300 to 4+180 for perennial sow thistle and tall buttercup. July 27, 2015 - Installed wattles at KP 4+100 and 4+130 to control erosion. 1<s>st</s> Year Issue/ Condition: Watercourse Crossing: Unnamed Tributary to Cutbank River
1<s>st</s> Year (2013) Issue(s): No concerns were observed at the watercourse crossing at KP 8.4. Vegetation establishment on banks and surrounding area is moderate. Erosion control measures are in place and functional.
2<s>nd</s> Year (2014) PCRM Assessment a: June 27. 2014 Tall buttercup present within 30m of watercourse at KP 8+380. All noxious weeds were handpicked and bagged. July 3, 2014- Un-named tributary to Cutbank River KP 8+360. Moderate flow observed, good vegetation establishment, banks appear stable. Cobble present up and down stream and over ditchline with no slumping. Silt fence either side of bank can be removed.  Noxious weeds identified within riparian area, recommend had picking. Diversion berm at top of south bank facing North exhibits slumping; no erosion - continue to monitor. July 14, 2014 - Removed silt fence on north and south bank at unnamed tributary to Cutbank River (KP 8+360). Picked and bagged tall buttercup on north bank. Removed steel pins remaining within straw wattles on north bank. July 26, 2014- Tall buttercup at KP 8+080, 4 plants picked and bagged within 30m of watercourse.
2015 PCRM Assessment and Work Completed: June 16, 2015 - RoW is well vegetated, approximately 75% vegetation cover on RoW compared to off RoW control. – Common, non-noxious weeds observed in limited densities. - Banks are defined and stable.  Subsidence was not noted. August 19, 2015 - Reset pipeline marker.
